resources.string: In including mode only notifications from the apps that are selected will sent to Pebble. In excluding mode all notifications will be sent to Pebble except those from applications selected.
Global filter by keywords/regular expressions for notifications that should be included/excluded from displaying.

string-array.name: settingShakeAction
string-array.item: Stop periodic vibration and enable autoswitch

resources.string: Global filter by keywords/regular expressions for notifications that should be included/excluded from displaying.

In this window you can define replacement pairs. Notification Center will swap specified characters with specified text. Use that to remove or translate characters that Pebble does not display to readable text.
You need to enter one character or unicode code for it!
No dictionary files found.\n\nPlace your replacement dictionary .txt files into NotificationCenter folder on your phone\'s storage and try again.

NC is like any other app on Pebble - when notification comes, it will close whatever app was active. This is fine most of the time, but for some apps you might not want this (for example you wouldn't want to interrupt running stopwatch). 

This view allows you to set NC to produce native Pebble notifications or simply turn off notifications if specific app is open on Pebble. 

For this feature to work, you need to enable Developer Connection inside Pebble (Time) app (under Settings -> Developer). After that press + button above to add apps.
Do you really want to clear whole notification history?
Opening Pebble app failed. Do you have Pebble app installed?
Do you want to open Pebble App Store to install Notification Center to your Pebble?
Open NC in Pebble App Store
When you press this button, all below settings will reset to default settings and will automatically sync with default settings until you change them manually.
Send notifications that are not just one time event, but something ongoing (for example ongoing file download or app instalation)
When checked, NC will also send completely blank notifications from this app

By default NC will not forward notification if notification with exact same text is already present in the notification tray. Check this if for example app generates periodic reminders with identical content.
When this is checked and new notification comes from this app, it will switch to that notification instead of queuing it. Only works on watchapp notifications.
When checked and you dismiss notification on the phone, it will also disappear on the Pebble. Only works on Android 4.3 and newer.

If app does not support Android Wear notifications, this is next best thing. It tries to improve formatting of inbox notifications (for example Gmail notification with multiple messages). It enables below options and generates notifications with a bit less clutter. It is recommended to keep this enabled unless notification looks weird on Pebble or is missing information. Android 4.1 or newer required.
Check this if app does not follow standards and displays new messages at the bottom instead of at the top.
Instead of displaying all the messages from the notification, display first one only.

Here you can define vibration pattern for this app. Pattern is in format \'vibrateTime, pauseTime, vibrateTime, pauseTime ...\', where times are in miliseconds. For example \'100, 200, 300\' will vibrate for 100ms, then wait 200 ms and then again vibrate for 300ms. Limit is 20 total numbers (so 10 vibrations and 10 pauses). Maximum total duration is 10 seconds. If you want to disable vibration, just enter 0. Only works on watchapp notifications.
Use vibration pattern provided by notification

Sometimes notifications provide their own notification pattern. By checking this, if notification has its own pattern, it will override one set above. This is especially useful if your app can provide different patterns for different notification or even has advanced options like linking vibration pattern to different contacts. Only works on watchapp notifications.

After initial vibration, Pebble will also vibrate every few seconds to remind you notification is there in case you did not felt it first time or you were busy. Here you can set interval of that vibration. You can also set it to 0 to disable the feature. Only works on watchapp notifications.

Here you can define list of regular expressions that notification needs to contain in order for it to display on Pebble. If this list is empty, this setting is simply ignored. That option is very powerful so it is recommended that you google and learn about regular expressions first. But for basics, you can just enter any word here (case sensitive!) and it should match notification. For example if you enter \'Pebble\' (without quotes), it will only match notifications that contain \'Pebble\'.
Same as above, except that here all messages that contain specified expressions will NOT be sent to Pebble.
This setting is equal to checking app on the app list
Making new backup will delete any previously made backups. Do you want to proceed?
This action will replace whole Notification Center config with a backuped one. Do you want to proceed?
Error while restoring! Did you even make backup?
Use sub text for notification subtitle

Use text below message list for notification subtitle instead of actual notification title. Works better for standard-compilant apps (for example Gmail shows mail address instead of \'X new messages\').
Save notifications from this app to notification history

In this view you can enable/disable apps and edit settings for specific app (click on the app name to change its settings). Default settings are global settings and apply to every app unless you set different options on specific app and override defaults that way.
Load actions meant for Android Wear (actions that appear when you swipe left on Wear). This includes reply and regular actions.
Here you can define list of canned responses that you can reply with if app has Android Wear voice reply support.

When writing messages on your Pebble you can type letter-by-letter or you can add paste whole phrases in. Here you defined which phrases will be available to you (up to 19). Only works on watchapp notifications.
%s\n\nPick correct text from menu or retry.
When this setting is enabled, you can dictate reply on android wear actions using microphone on the phone or one connected to the phone (BT headset for example).

When this setting is enabled, you can dictate reply on android wear actions using microphone on the Pebble Time (does not work on classic Pebble obviously). You need to enable Notification Center in Pebble Time notification settings for this to work.
When this setting is enabled, you write reply messages from your Pebble. Only works on watchapp notifications.
Some apps do not automatically dismiss notification after you reply to it. By checking this option NC will take care of it.

Instead of inbox notifications, display group notifications for Android Wear. This will display full individual messages instead of just displaying summary of your inbox when you receive multiple messages. Requires at least Android 4.3 or newer and app needs to implement Android Wear notifications for it to work.

Here you can add tasker tasks that will be added to that app\'s actions. When you select that task on the Pebble, tasker task will be executed. You need to enable external access in tasker to use this option.
Do you want to remove task %s from actions?

%s\n\n
Use retry from actions menu to retry voice input.

You can use those variables in task that is triggered by NC:

 %ncappname = name of the app that sent notification

 %ncappppkg = package of the app that sent notification

 %ncid = ID of the notification

 %nctag = Tag of the notification

 %nctitle = Title of the notification

 %ncsubtitle = Subtitle of the notification

 %nctext = Text of the notification

Intent triggered by NC will contain those extras:

 ncappname = name of the app that sent notification

 ncappppkg = package of the app that sent notification

 ncid = ID of the notification

 nctag = Tag of the notification

 nctitle = Title of the notification

 ncsubtitle = Subtitle of the notification

 nctext = Text of the notification
Tasker\'s External Access is turned off.

What happens when you press SELECT button on Pebble. Menu actions are equal to pressing corresponding action in action menu. For example if you pick \"Action menu item 3\" then pressing SELECT button would be equal to opening action menu and selecting 3rd action. Only works on watchapp notifications.
Same as above except that this actions is executed when you hold SELECT button. Only works on watchapp notifications.

Same as above except that this actions is executed when you shake your Pebble. Enable autoswitch action means that Pebble will automatically switch to new notification when it comes if you shook your Pebble on old one. Only works on watchapp notifications.
Load notification actions that appear on the phone\'s notifications (buttons below notification text).
You need to install tasker to use this action.

Allows you to specify minimum amount of seconds that must pass between two notifications for second to vibrate. For example if you set this to 10 and you receive notification, it won\'t vibrate for notifications from this app for next 10 seconds. Useful for group chat notifications where lots of messages can be sent in very short time. Set to 0 to disable. Only works on watchapp notifications.

Allows you to specify minimum amount of seconds that must pass between two notifications for the second to be sent to Pebble. For example if you set this to 10 and you receive a notification, further notifications from this app won\'t be sent to Pebble for next 10 seconds. Useful for group chat notifications where lots of messages can be sent in very short time. Set to 0 to disable.
If this option is enabled and you put your phone into do not disturb mode, Notification Center won\'t send any notifications to the Pebble.
When quiet hours are enabled, Pebble won\'t receive messages from this app in specified time.
Use this when you want to trigger something in tasker-like apps or other 3rd party apps that support intent events.
Disable notifications when screen is on
Disable new notifications popping up when screen is on. Useful to prevent Pebble buzzing if you are on your phone anyway.

Apps can mark notifications as local only, which means they should not leave the phone. When checked, NC will respect that option. You can use this to quickly filter out notifications that are useless on the watch (for example app updates), but keep in mind that not apps support it and some apps might falsely mark it.

When app posts notification, it assigns it priority. Lower priority notifications are meant to be used for actions that user is not needed to react immediatelly, while higher priority need instant attention (for example phone call notification has MAX priority). You can recognize lower priority notifications by the fact that their icons do not appear on statusbar on some phones/OS versions.
Use this title instead of application name. Useful if application\'s name is too long. Leave empty to use default app name. Leave just one space to remove app title altogether.

NC watchapp can store about 4000 english characters and is limited to displaying 10 notifications at once. Each notification is limited to 2000 characters for performance reasons.


That means you can display anywhere between 2 long notifications or 10 short notifications. If app generates notifications that are very long and you generally don't read them fully, you can limit length of them to fit as many of them on the watch as possible.


Also keep in mind that emoji and non-english characters usually take more space than plain english characters so notifications containing them will take more space. Only works on watchapp notifications, native will have much shorter text limit.
Always try to retrieve text from actual statusbar notification instead of using text that is separately provided by app itself. Use when notification on Pebble is different from one in statusbar.

When checked, notificaiton text will be initially hidden and will require you to select Show action from action menu to uncover it. This gives you additional degree of privacy as you can decide when to see notification text (when people are not around to look at your watch).

Color of the statusbar above notification. This can be used to quickly distinguish between apps (for example Gmail is red, Facebook is blue etc.). By default this setting will use color provided by app or default to black if app does not provide color. But you can customize it and pick your own color if app does not provide it or you don\'t like one app provides.

Icon of the notification. Only for native notifications. Blank icon (just grey square) means NC will try to automatically determine the icon of the app. Images are loaded from the internet, so you may not be able to change this setting while offline.

Display notification image in the background of the text. Depending on the app it can be received image (for example MMS message with image), image of the contact that send the message or just stock icon for this type of notification (for example envelope icon for mail). Only works on Pebble Time and with watchapp notifications.
Do not vibrate for notification updates

Do not vibrate if app only updated the text on existing notification instead of posting new one and existing notification is still displayed on your Pebble. For example if you are receiving chat notifications, watch won\'t vibrate for more messages from this chat until you dismiss existing notification from the Pebble. Only works on watchapp notifications.
Do you want to delete that Pebble app setting? Setting for \"Other apps\" will apply if you do that.
Hint: unless notification not appearing in statusbar is a requirement, I recommend you use Tasker\'s Alert -> Notify action. It allows you to also specify actions and dismiss notification at will.
Please accept permission and select the option again.
Cannot this option without storage permission.
Display icon of the notification on the watchapp notifications
\n\n(Notification was sent in NC mode because Pebble\'s developer connection is not active)
Show action that allows quick disabling of this app.
